    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentNode

        public WorkflowBean getCurrentNode()
        Returns the WorkflowBean currently visited.
        Returns:
        the WorkflowBean currently visited

      • getCurrentPath

        public Stack<WorkflowBean> getCurrentPath()
        Return the current path of WorkflowBeans.

        The list will never contain the current node, which can instead be found in getCurrentNode(). That means that Stack.peek() will be the intermediate parent of the current node.

        The first object of the stack will be the initial object where WorkflowBean.accept(Visitor) was called, not necessarily the WorkflowBundle.

        So for instance if you are in visit(WorkflowBean) on an InputProcessorPort, getCurrentPath() will have a list [workflowBundle, workflow, processor]. This should generally match the path from following Child.getParent() recursively.

        This method returns the same List instance throughout the use of the visitor, it is dynamically modified by visitEnter(WorkflowBean) and visitLeave(WorkflowBean).

        Returns:
        A List of the current path of the ancestors of the currently visiting WorkflowBean.

      • visit

        public abstract boolean visit()
        Similar to Visitor.visit(WorkflowBean) - but called for every node, even if it can have children.

        The current node is available in getCurrentNode().

        Returns:
        true if this node's children should be visited. (return value is ignored for nodes which can't have children)

      • visit

        public final boolean visit(WorkflowBean node)
        Final to maintain current path. Override visit() instead.
        Specified by:
        visit in interface Visitor
        Parameters:
        node - the currently visited WorkflowBean
        Returns:
        true if the visits over the current beans' siblings should continue, false to immediately leave the parent.
        See Also:
        visit()

      • visitEnter

        public final boolean visitEnter(WorkflowBean node)
        Final to maintain current path. Override visit() instead.
        Specified by:
        visitEnter in interface Visitor
        Parameters:
        node - the currently visited WorkflowBean
        Returns:
        true if the children of this bean should be visited.
        See Also:
        visit()

      • visitLeave

        public boolean visitLeave()
        Override this method to be informed when leaving a node. Similar to Visitor.visitLeave(WorkflowBean), but also called for nodes which can't have children.

        The current node is present in getCurrentPath() and can be retrieved using getCurrentNode().

        Returns:
        true if the visits over the current beans' siblings should continue, false to immediately leave the parent.

      • visitLeave

        public final boolean visitLeave(WorkflowBean node)
        Final to maintain current path. Override visitLeave() instead.
        Specified by:
        visitLeave in interface Visitor
        Parameters:
        node - the currently visited WorkflowBean
        Returns:
        false if the visits over the current beans' siblings should continue, false to immediately leave the parent.
        See Also:
        visitLeave()
